remarks: A bounded, continuous function on an open bounded interval is integrable.  The function must be bounded.  For a counterexample, consider ` F = ( x e. ( 0 (,) 1 ) |-> ( 1 / x ) ) ` .  See ~ cniccibl for closed bounded intervals.  (Contributed by Jon Pennant, 31-May-2019.)

cnioobibld.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
cnioobibld.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( ( A (,) B ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
cnioobibld.4 $e |- ( ph -> E. x e. RR A. y e. dom F ( abs ` ( F ` y ) ) <_ x ) $.
cnioobibld $p |- ( ph -> F e. L^1 ) $.
$d F x y $.
